Comments_List:
I gained a historical understanding of the field of American Studies and its contemporary formations. From transatlantic, transpacific, hemispheric, archipelagic, indigenous places, borders, etc. all these frameworks helped me better understand the field and my potential entry points for intervention. 

I also practiced public speaking through class presentations.
An understanding of the field of American Studies, multiple methodological approaches to geographical frameworks, feminist and literature studies.

I learned so much in this class, and I'm still ruminating on everything, but I think most importantly I was exposed to the work of scholars who were thinking deeply and differently about ways of framing American studies
Many dimensions of a global American Studies
More time spent on individual readings would have helped focus discussion at times and would allow for more in depth engagement with a text

Strengths: Great readings and discussion! 
Weaknesses: Sometimes too much reading each week to really be able to engage meaningfully with each one.
Yes, I would recommend this course to students in American Studies because it fills the gaps that were present in my American Scholars class.
Absolutely. Great overview and discussion, and prof took time to organise and lead class
Yes, absolutely. A fundamental course for any American Studies student
